name: The Inn of the Tankards
tagline: Steep-sided, flat-headed hills, many topped with fluttering banners of House Ramius.
description: Steep-sided, flat-headed hills, many topped with fluttering banners of House Ramius.

points_of_interest.name: The Inn of the Tankards
points_of_interest.description: At the oft-trodden junction near the hex's centre stands an inn, its lower floor entirely obscured by old growth trees.
points_of_interest.tagline: A breggle arm crossing a human arm, each holding a frothing tankard.
points_of_interest.interior: Large and busy, the cacophony of patrons' voices verging on harsh. Conspicuously clean, all walls freshly painted, all wooden surfaces polished to a bright sheen. The inn is owned by a shorthorn couple: Crump Elbowgen frenetically serves patrons, while his wife Nelga alternates between poring over a ledger and roaming the grounds compulsively in search of maintenance tasks.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: Shorthorn and human merchants. The Elbowgens have owned it for two years; the previous owner drowned in a nearby well in an apparent drunken mishap.

roll_tables.name: Hauntings
roll_tables.description: While in bed, 1 random party member experiences an event from the Hauntings table

entries.description: Corpse-like female elfish visage in window.
Bed levitates to the sound of mocking laughter.
Disembodied moaning under the bed, in closets, etc.
Window opens and slams shut multiple times.

special_features: Negative atmosphere: All Reaction Rolls suffer a â€“1 penalty in the inn
Sleepwalker: Watchful PCs may observe Nelga moving in a trance-like state to the basement
Secret chamber: A damp, vaulted brick chamber with drawings depicting the inn in various forms
Interrupting Nelga: The house causes a torrent of bricks to fall onto the PCs (Save Versus Hold or take 1d4 damage)

Exorcising: Using magic of curse removal or successfully turning undead against a Level 5 monster in the secret chamber causes foetid, black water to burst from the walls, and a mournful, plangent wail
secrets: The inn was unwittingly built with wood felled in an accursed glade
It is now a sentient, malevolent entity that instigates and feeds on terror, strife, sorrow, and murder
It delights in slowly destroying its proprietors and causing their untimely end

npcs.name: Nelga Elbowgen
npcs.title: Shorthorn Landlady
npcs.description: White fur and a calico dress. She talks of nothing but the inn, in language that personifies it.
npcs.speech: Direct, then trailing off. Woldish, Gaffe.
desires: To keep the inn utterly, painfully clean
secrets: Gradually becoming obsessed with the inn, treating it as if it were alive
Sleepwalks to secret chamber and sketches manically

npcs.name: Crump Elbowgen
npcs.title: Shorthorn Landlord
npcs.description: Brown fur with black patches, in a crisply pressed waistcoat. Crump can feel his wife is not entirely present.

items.name: Elder tea
items.description: Served in fine porcelain. 1gp per serving.

dm_notes: Services at the Inn of the Tankards: Lodgings and food of common quality (DPB).
